required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Virtual Intervention to Improve Medication Adherence in Pediatric Cancer: MedSupport
clinical_study.official_title: A Virtual Intervention to Improve Medication Adherence in Pediatric Cancer: MedSupport

brief_summary.textblock: To develop a cancer center level practice intervention to promote treatment adherence and reduce outcome disparities in pediatric cancer survivors

detailed_description.textblock: To conduct a pilot study to assess the feasibility and acceptability of the Social Determinants of Adherence intervention

primary_outcome.description: Feasibility of intervention as assessed by retention rates

secondary_outcome.description: Will be assessed by results of SDOA questionnaire an 8 item questionnaire rated on a 5-point Likert scale (0-I never experienced this ; 5 - I experience this quite a lot)
REDCap analytics will track the rate of opened barrier reports

assessed by Medication Event Monitoring Systems (MEMS) , which will be placed on top of medication bottle and will document the number of times the bottle is opened. Number will be totalled at end of study

arm_group.description: Questionnaires along with instructional video for the use of Medication Event Monitoring System (MEMS)
Will complete pre and post survey about medication education practices

intervention.description: How many times a 7 question Survey on medication education practices is opened

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Parents/caregivers of pediatric patients must meet the following criteria to be eligible:
- Parents/guardians of child that has been diagnosed with any cancer.
- Parents/guardians of child with any cancer between age 0 and 18.
- Parents/guardians of child on home-based oral anti-cancer therapy or supportive care therapy.
- The clinician for the family agrees to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants will be excluded from this study if unwilling or unable to complete the assessment in English
